title: Scientific Notation Decoder
description: Scientific calculators need to parse numbers in scientific notation. These numbers have a base number (with optional decimal), followed by 'e' or 'E', then an optional sign, and finally the exponent digits. Decode these precise scientific formats.
solutionSummary: Uses integer part \d+, optional decimal (\.\d+)?, case-insensitive exponent [eE], optional sign [+-]?, and required exponent digits. Demonstrates scientific notation parsing with optional components.
